abstract: Residents of West Baltimore's poverty-stricken Upton-Druid Heights neighborhood, which is 94 percent black, die from almost every major disease at significantly higher rates than rest of city and their life expectancy is just 68 years; statistics underlie anger and frustration of poor black Americans that is at heart of ongoing nationwide protests about policing.
lead_paragraph: In Upton-Druid Heights — one of Baltimore’s poorest neighborhoods and the scene of some of its most vocal protests — residents die from nearly every major disease at substantially higher rates than the city as a whole.

headline.main: Health Problems Take Root in a West Baltimore Neighborhood That Is Sick of Neglect
headline.print_headline: Health Problems Take Root in a Neighborhood That Is Sick of Neglect

snippet: In Upton-Druid Heights — one of Baltimore’s poorest neighborhoods and the scene of some of its most vocal protests — residents die from nearly every major disease at substantially higher rates than the city as a whole.
